body: I'm not sure why this is necessary / why it works at all, because from where I'm sitting `getTracingState` takes a list of variables: `std::shared_ptr<TracingState> getTracingState(const variable_list& vars)`. Shouldn't we instead be using something like flatten rather than `_first_var` here?
body_html: I'm not sure why this is necessary / why it works at all, because from where I'm sitting getTracingState takes a list of variables: std::shared_ptr<TracingState> getTracingState(const variable_list& vars). Shouldn't we instead be using something like flatten rather than _first_var here?
body_text: I'm not sure why this is necessary / why it works at all, because from where I'm sitting getTracingState takes a list of variables: std::shared_ptr<TracingState> getTracingState(const variable_list& vars). Shouldn't we instead be using something like flatten rather than _first_var here?
